text: does HS cache the value of a cookie that is set?
we have code that sets a cookie but then when trying to retrieve it via hubl, its not working right away.

<@U2H3TT8F2> If you set a cookie on same visit you won't be able to access it until next page view or return visit (if I'm not mistaken) ... since HubL is evaluated before the cookie values are set via JS
At least that's what I've encountered on my uses of cookie sets / retrieval via HubL ... You can set all cookies then flip a quick redirect if you can suffer the google penalty on the page
Or drop the user on a splash page where they take an action (and it sets all the cookies) then navigates to the next page
so we have a form someone fills out which does do a page refresh when it sets the cookie, but we are still having the caching issue
Able to give an example page? Would be good to go see the flow, network inspector, and cookies set
sadly I can't provide that. Sorry :disappointed:
it’s a bug with our server-side caching. We’re looking into it
The fix is actually in one of our open source libraries if you’re interested in the details <https://github.com/HubSpot/jinjava/pull/147>
